metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9667 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
sfnt/ttload.c in FreeType before 2.5.4 proceeds with offset+length calculations without restricting the values, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (integer overflow and out-of-bounds read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted SFNT table.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9667` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freetype2-demos - 2.5.2-1ubuntu2.4
libfreetype6 - 2.5.2-1ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freetype package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.2-1ubuntu2.4').
